title: Effects of Final State Interactions on Landau Singularities
authors: Ajay S. Sakthivasan, Maxim Mai, Akaki Rusetsky, Michael D\"oring
abstract:
In certain kinematic and particle mass configurations, triangle singularities
may lead to line-shapes which mimic the effects of resonances. This well-known
effect is scrutinized here in the presence of final-state rescattering. The
goal is achieved first by utilizing general arguments provided by Landau
equations, and second by applying a modern scattering formalism with explicit
two- and three-body unitarity.
